seo.title: Betterlytics | Privacy-First Web Analytics
seo.description: Betterlytics is a privacy-first, open-source alternative to Google Analytics. Get GDPR-compliant, cookieless insights without invasive tracking, while respecting user privacy.

notFound.title: 404 - Page Not Found
notFound.description: This page seems to have wandered off into the analytics dimension. Don't worry though, we've got you covered!

seo.title: About Betterlytics | Privacy-First Web Analytics
seo.description: Learn how Betterlytics builds open-source, cookieless analytics that protect user privacy, stay fully GDPR-compliant, and empower transparent web insights.

about.intro: We're building the future of web analytics: privacy-first, open source, and designed for the modern web. No more choosing between powerful insights and respecting your visitors' privacy.

howWeStarted.title: How We Started
howWeStarted.p1: Betterlytics was born out of real frustration. Our team was developing a Vendor Management System when we hit a wall with web analytics. Every solution we evaluated forced us into the same impossible choice: either compromise our users' privacy or settle for inadequate insights.
howWeStarted.p2: Traditional analytics tools force you to choose between comprehensive insights and user privacy. We believe that's a false choice. Betterlytics proves you can have powerful, actionable analytics while being completely privacy-compliant and respectful of your visitors.
howWeStarted.p3: What started as a solution for our own needs became something much bigger: a mission to build analytics tools that respect both website owners and their visitors. Every feature is designed with privacy and performance as equal priorities.

whyPrivacyFirst.title: Why Privacy-First Analytics Matter
whyPrivacyFirst.p1: The web analytics industry has been dominated by surveillance capitalism for too long. Major analytics providers collect vast amounts of personal data, track users across websites, and use this information to build detailed behavioral profiles for advertising purposes.
whyPrivacyFirst.p2: We don't believe website owners should have to compromise their visitors' privacy to understand how their site performs. Betterlytics collects only the essential metrics you need: no cookies, no personal data, no cross-site tracking. Your visitors' privacy is respected by default.

builtInOpen.title: Built in the Open
builtInOpen.p1: Betterlytics is completely open source under the AGPL-3.0 license. This isn't just about transparency, it's about accountability. Anyone can inspect our code, verify our privacy claims, and contribute to making the platform better.
builtInOpen.p2: Open source also means freedom. You can self-host Betterlytics on your own infrastructure, ensuring complete control over your data. No vendor lock-in, no surprise policy changes, no sudden price increases.

privacyPerformance.title: Privacy and Performance in Perfect Balance
privacyPerformance.p1: We obsess over both privacy and performance equally because your website's speed matters just as much as your visitors' privacy. Our tracking script weighs less than 2KB. Compare that to Google Analytics' bloated 45KB+ payload. Built with modern web standards and optimized for speed, Betterlytics won't slow down your site.
privacyPerformance.p2: Under the hood, we use cutting-edge technology: Rust for high-performance data processing, ClickHouse for lightning-fast analytical queries, and Next.js 15 for a modern, responsive dashboard experience. Every technical decision prioritizes both user privacy and system performance.

builtForEveryone.title: Built for Everyone
builtForEveryone.p1: Whether you're running a personal blog, a growing SaaS platform, an e-commerce store, or an enterprise website, Betterlytics is designed to meet your needs. We understand that different organizations have different requirements, from simple traffic insights to complex user journey analysis.
builtForEveryone.p2: Integration takes minutes, not hours. Our dashboard is intuitive and well-documented, showing you what you need to know without drowning you in unnecessary complexity. While we don't have a public API yet, every dashboard feature is thoroughly documented to help you get the most out of your analytics.

privacyRegulations.title: Privacy Regulations Made Simple
privacyRegulations.p1: GDPR, CCPA, PECR compliant. Privacy regulations shouldn't be a compliance nightmare. Because Betterlytics doesn't collect personal data or use cookies, you're compliant by default. No cookie banners required, no consent management needed.
privacyRegulations.p2: This simplicity extends to your users too. They can focus on your content instead of being interrupted by privacy notices and consent forms. Better experience for everyone.
privacyRegulations.p3Prefix: We're based in the European Union and all data processing occurs within EU boundaries. Your data never leaves the EU, ensuring full compliance with GDPR requirements. For detailed information about how we handle your data, see our

communityDriven.title: Community-Driven Development
communityDriven.p1: Betterlytics grows through community feedback and contributions. We listen to developers, implement requested features, and maintain the platform based on real user needs; not investor demands or advertising revenue requirements. We want to deeply thank our community for their feedback and contributions.
communityDriven.p2: Our sustainable business model means we can focus on building the best analytics platform possible. We're funded by our users, not by selling their data. This alignment of incentives ensures we'll always prioritize privacy and performance and never compromise on either.

future.title: The Future of Web Analytics
future.quote: We believe businesses should be able to understand their audience without sacrificing privacy or making needless compromises on ethics. Analytics can be both powerful and respectful by design.
future.p1: This vision drives everything we build. Every feature, every optimization, every decision is guided by our commitment to privacy-first analytics that everyone can trust and use.

cta.title: Ready to Get Started?
cta.lead: Join the growing community of businesses who refuse to compromise on privacy.

seo.title: Contact Betterlytics | Privacy-First Analytics
seo.description: Get in touch with the Betterlytics team for support, feedback, or partnership inquiries about our open-source, privacy-first web analytics platform.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.intro: Questions about Betterlytics? Need support with your analytics setup? Our team is ready to assist you.

getInTouch.title: Get in Touch
getInTouch.description: Whether you need technical support, have questions about our features, or want to discuss enterprise solutions, we're here to help.

integrate.question: How do I integrate Betterlytics with my website?
integrate.answer: Integration is simple! Just add our lightweight script tag to your website or install our NPM package. Check our documentation for detailed setup guides for all major frameworks.

gdpr.question: Is Betterlytics really GDPR compliant?
gdpr.answer: Yes, absolutely! We don't use cookies, don't collect personal data, and all data processing is done in compliance with GDPR, CCPA, and other privacy regulations.

migrate.question: Can I migrate from Google Analytics?
migrate.answer: Not yet! But we're working hard to implement this feature and will provide a migration guide and tools to help you transition from Google Analytics.

freePlan.question: What's included in the free plan?
freePlan.answer: The free self-hosted plan includes up to 10,000 tracked events, full dashboard access and community support. Perfect for getting started! No credit card required, no strings attached.

cloud.question: How does the cloud hosting work?
cloud.answer: Our cloud hosting provides a fully managed Betterlytics instance with automatic updates, backups, and 99.9% uptime SLA. No server management required!

support.question: Do you offer support for self-hosted instances?
support.answer: Partially! We provide community support through GitHub and Discord for self-hosted instances, but our priority is to support our cloud hosting customers.

docs.title: Documentation
docs.description: Explore our guides for getting started, integrations with popular frameworks, and detailed feature documentation.

cta.lead: Can't find what you're looking for?

seo.title: Changelog | Betterlytics Release Notes & Product Updates
seo.description: Read every Betterlytics release note in one place. Follow product updates, reliability fixes, and roadmap highlights for our privacy-first analytics platform.

hero.title: Betterlytics changelog
hero.lead: See what's new in Betterlytics! From fresh features to performance fixes, follow our journey and discover how your analytics experience keeps getting better.

feed.subhead: Fresh releases ship monthly. Scroll chronologically to revisit every iteration.
feed.loadMore: Keep scrolling. Newer releases will load automatically.
feed.end: Thanks for reading all the way back. You've reached the beginning of the Betterlytics changelog.

seo.title: Privacy Policy | GDPR & Cookieless Analytics
seo.description: Betterlytics Privacy Policy ‚Äî GDPR-compliant and cookieless by design. Learn how we protect your data and ensure privacy through anonymous analytics.

privacy.translationDisclaimer: This document is provided in multiple languages for convenience. In case of discrepancies, the English version shall prevail.
privacy.title: Betterlytics Privacy Policy

tldr.title: TL;DR
tldr.body: For website visitors, we do not use cookies and we do not collect any personal data. If you decide to create an account, we ask for the bare minimum and only share it with services that are absolutely necessary for the app to function.

scope.title: Scope of This Policy
scope.body: This privacy policy applies exclusively to the Betterlytics hosted cloud service available at betterlytics.io and our official domains. It does not apply to self-hosted installations of our open source software. If you self-host Betterlytics, you are responsible for your own privacy policy, data processing practices, and legal compliance.

intro.p1: At Betterlytics, we are committed to complying with GDPR, CCPA, PECR and other privacy regulations. The privacy of your data ‚Äî and it is your data, not ours! ‚Äî is a big deal to us. We are based in the European Union and all data processing occurs within EU boundaries.
intro.p2: In this policy, we lay out what data we collect and why, how your data is handled and your rights to your data. We promise we never sell your data: never have, never will.

visitor.title: As a visitor to websites using Betterlytics
visitor.lead: The privacy of website visitors is important to us. We have designed our analytics system to be completely cookieless and privacy-focused. As a visitor to websites using Betterlytics:
visitor.li1: By default, Betterlytics does not collect personal information or use cookies.
visitor.li2: No cookies or browser storage are ever used or stored.
visitor.li3: No information is shared with, sent to or sold to third-parties.
visitor.li4: No information is shared with advertising companies.
visitor.li5: No information is mined and harvested for personal and behavioral trends.
visitor.finalRemarks1: All analytics data is aggregated and anonymized to prevent identification of individual visitors. Certain optional features (such as session replay, custom identifiers, or user event tracking) may enable website owners to collect additional data, which could include personal or pseudo-anonymous information depending on configuration. In such cases, the website owner ‚Äî not Betterlytics ‚Äî is the data controller and is responsible for obtaining consent and ensuring compliance with applicable privacy laws (such as GDPR or CCPA).
visitor.finalRemarks2: While Betterlytics is designed to collect only anonymized data by default, it is possible that personal data may be accidentally transmitted by website owners ‚Äî for example, via URL paths, query parameters, or custom event data. In such cases, Betterlytics acts as a data processor of the received data and processes it solely according to our standard procedures. Website owners remain the data controllers and are responsible for masking or removing personal data and ensuring compliance with applicable privacy laws (such as GDPR or CCPA). We encourage website owners to follow best practices to prevent personal data from being sent accidentally. For more information about responsibilities related to the use of Betterlytics and optional features, please refer to our Terms of Service.
visitor.finalRemarks3: When processing website visitor data that includes personal or pseudo-anonymous information on behalf of our customers, Betterlytics acts as a data processor under GDPR, and the website owner acts as the data controller responsible for determining the lawful basis for processing and ensuring compliance.

anonymous.title: What anonymous data we collect and why

pageViews.title: Page Views and Navigation
pageViews.body: We track which pages are visited and navigation patterns to help website owners understand how their content is being consumed. We collect the URL path (without query parameters to prevent accidental tracking of sensitive data) and referrer information.

deviceBrowser.title: Device and Browser Information
deviceBrowser.body: We parse the user agent string to determine browser type, operating system, and device category (mobile, tablet, desktop, laptop). Screen resolution is bucketed into categories (small, medium, large) rather than storing exact dimensions.

geographic.title: Geographic Information
geographic.body: We determine the visitor's country from their IP address using a GeoIP database. The IP address itself is immediately anonymized by removing the last octet (IPv4) or using only the first 64 bits (IPv6) before any processing.

anonymousId.title: Anonymous Visitor Identification
anonymousId.body: We generate an anonymous visitor fingerprint using a cryptographic hash of the anonymized IP address, bucketed screen resolution, browser name, and a daily rotating salt. This allows us to count unique visitors without tracking individuals. The fingerprint changes daily, ensuring long-term anonymity.

sessionTracking.title: Session Tracking
sessionTracking.body: We track sessions to understand how visitors engage with websites. Sessions automatically expire after 30 minutes of inactivity and are stored only in server memory, never in cookies or browser storage.

anonymous.finalRemarks: This section describes Betterlytics' default, anonymized data collection. Customers who enable optional features that collect additional data are responsible for ensuring their own compliance with data protection laws.

processStore.title: How we process and store data
processStore.li1: EU-based hosting: All data is processed and stored on servers located within the European Union, ensuring GDPR compliance.
processStore.li2: Immediate anonymization: IP addresses are anonymized immediately upon receipt, before any processing or storage occurs.
processStore.li3: No cross-site tracking: Each website's data is isolated and tracked separately with unique site identifiers.
processStore.li4: Aggregated reporting: All analytics reports show aggregated data only, with no ability to identify individual visitors.
processStore.li5: Daily fingerprint rotation: Visitor fingerprints change daily, preventing long-term tracking of individuals.

customer.title: As a customer and subscriber of Betterlytics
customer.lead: Our guiding principle is to collect only what we need and process this information solely to provide you with the service you signed up for.

whatWeCollect.title: What we collect and why
whatWeCollect.email: Email address: Required to create an account, send you essential service communications, and provide customer support.
whatWeCollect.auth: Authentication data: Secure session tokens to keep you logged in to your dashboard.
whatWeCollect.websiteConfig: Website configuration: Domain names and site settings you configure for your analytics tracking.
whatWeCollect.usage: Usage data: How you use our dashboard to improve our service and provide support.

thirdParty.title: Third-party services
thirdParty.intro: We use a select number of trusted, EU-based service providers:
thirdParty.li1: Payment processing (if applicable) through EU-compliant payment processors
thirdParty.li2: Email delivery for transactional emails and notifications
thirdParty.outro: We only share the minimum necessary information with these providers and contractually bind them to protect your data according to GDPR standards.

customer.cookieUse: Betterlytics uses cookies strictly for necessary service functionality. These cookies are not used for analytics or marketing purposes.
customer.responsibility: Website owners are responsible for ensuring their use of Betterlytics complies with applicable privacy laws. For more details, please see our Terms of Service and Data Processing Agreement.

dataRetention.title: Data retention
dataRetention.li1: Account deletion: When you delete your account, ALL data is permanently deleted immediately - this includes your personal data (email, payment information, account settings) AND all website analytics data. No exceptions, no retention period.
dataRetention.li2: Subscription cancellation (without account deletion): If you cancel your subscription but keep your account, we retain your analytics data for up to 1 month in case you decide to reactivate, after which it is permanently deleted.
dataRetention.li3: Session data: Visitor sessions are stored only in server memory and automatically expire after 30 minutes of inactivity.
dataRetention.footer: You always have the right to immediate deletion of all data.

rights.title: Your rights under GDPR
rights.intro: As a data subject under GDPR, you have the following rights:
rights.li1: Right of access: Request a copy of your personal data
rights.li2: Right to rectification: Correct inaccurate personal data
rights.li3: Right to erasure: Request deletion of your personal data
rights.li4: Right to restrict processing: Limit how we use your data
rights.li5: Right to data portability: Receive your data in a portable format
rights.li6: Right to object: Object to processing based on legitimate interests
rights.li7: Right to withdraw consent: Withdraw consent for data processing
rights.contact: To exercise any of these rights, please contact us at privacy@betterlytics.io

noCookies.title: No cookies policy
noCookies.body: Betterlytics does not use any cookies for tracking website visitors. We achieve all necessary analytics functionality through cookieless, server-side processing. This means websites using Betterlytics do not need to display cookie consent banners for our analytics tracking.

security.title: Data security
security.li1: All data transmission is encrypted using TLS 1.3
security.li2: Data at rest is encrypted using industry-standard encryption
security.li3: Access to data is strictly limited to authorized personnel
security.li4: All servers are located in secure EU data centers

changes.title: Changes to this privacy policy
changes.body: We may update this policy as needed to comply with relevant regulations and reflect any new practices. Whenever we make significant changes to our policies, we will notify our customers via email and announce them on our website.

contact.title: Contact us
contact.lead: If you have any questions, comments, or concerns about this privacy policy, your data, or your rights with respect to your information, please contact us:
contact.footer1: üá™üá∫ Made and hosted in the European Union
contact.footer2: Committed to privacy, transparency, and GDPR compliance

seo.title: Terms of Service | Privacy-First Analytics
seo.description: Read Betterlytics' Terms of Service ‚Äî learn about your rights, responsibilities, and usage policies for our privacy-first web analytics platform.

terms.translationDisclaimer: This document is provided in multiple languages for convenience. In case of discrepancies, the English version shall prevail.
terms.title: Betterlytics Terms of Service

scope.title: Scope of These Terms
scope.body: These Terms of Service apply exclusively to the Betterlytics hosted cloud service available at betterlytics.io and our official domains. They do not apply to self-hosted installations of our open source software. If you self-host Betterlytics, you are responsible for your own terms of service, data processing, and legal compliance.

intro.p1: Thank you for using Betterlytics! When we say "company", "we", "our", "us", "service" or "services" in this document, we are referring to Betterlytics and our privacy-focused web analytics platform.
intro.p2: When we say "customer", "you", "your", "yours" or "you're" in this document, we are referring to the entity, individual, or organization that signs up for Betterlytics and installs our analytics script(s) on their website(s) to use our service.
intro.p3: We may update these Terms of Service in the future. Whenever we make significant changes to our policies, we will notify our customers via email and announce them on our website. When you use our service, now or in the future, you are agreeing to the latest Terms of Service.
intro.p4: If you do not agree to these Terms of Service, do not use this service. Violation of any of the terms below may result in the termination of your account.

account.title: Account Terms
account.li1: Security responsibility: You are responsible for maintaining the security of your account and password. Betterlytics cannot and will not be liable for any loss or damage from your failure to comply with this security obligation.
account.li2: Account activity: You are responsible for any activity that occurs under your account, including activity by team members you invite to your account.
account.li3: Legal compliance: You may not use our service for any illegal purpose or to violate any laws in your jurisdiction.
account.li4: Registration requirements: You must provide a valid email address to complete the signup process. You must be a human - accounts registered by bots or automated methods are not permitted.
account.li5: Website ownership: You must own or have explicit permission to install our analytics script on any website you track with Betterlytics.
account.li6: Data accuracy: You agree to provide accurate information about your websites and not to intentionally send false or misleading data to our service.
account.li7: Age requirements: You must be at least 18 years old to use our service. If you are between 13-17, you may use our service only with parental consent.

acceptableUse.title: Acceptable Use
acceptableUse.intro: Betterlytics is designed for legitimate website analytics and is built as an open source project for transparency. You agree not to use our service to:
acceptableUse.li1: Track visitors without their knowledge or in violation of privacy laws
acceptableUse.li2: Collect or process personally identifiable information (PII) unless you have a lawful basis to do so under applicable privacy laws (such as valid user consent). By default, Betterlytics is designed to avoid collecting PII. Certain optional features ‚Äî such as session replay, custom identifiers, or user event tracking ‚Äî or accidental inclusion of personal data in URLs, query parameters, or event payloads, may result in the collection of personal or pseudo-anonymous information. In such cases, the website owner ‚Äî not Betterlytics ‚Äî is the data controller and is responsible for masking, obtaining consent, and ensuring compliance with applicable privacy laws (such as GDPR or CCPA).
acceptableUse.li3: Generate artificial or bot traffic to inflate statistics or abuse our infrastructure
acceptableUse.li4: Track websites you don't own without explicit permission
acceptableUse.li5: Abuse our service infrastructure, bypass rate limits, or send malformed data that could harm our systems
acceptableUse.li6: Use our service to harm, harass, or violate the privacy of any individual
acceptableUse.li7: Violate any applicable laws, including GDPR, CCPA, or other relevant privacy/data protection laws
acceptableUse.li8: Resell, sublicense, or provide the Service (or substantial parts thereof) to third parties as a hosted analytics service without prior written consent

payment.title: Payment, Refunds, and Plan Changes
payment.freeTierBody: We offer a permanently free tier with a monthly event limit as specified on our pricing page. No credit card is required for the free tier. We do not sell your data - ever, regardless of which plan you use.
payment.billingBody: You can use our free tier indefinitely within the monthly event limits. For higher usage, you need to upgrade to a paid plan and pay in advance. If you exceed plan limits without upgrading, you risk losing excess data. If paid accounts become overdue, we will freeze the account until payment is made.
payment.limitsBody: Each plan includes a monthly limit of events (pageviews, custom events, etc.). Unused events do not roll over to the next month. You will never be charged extra for occasional traffic spikes. If you consistently exceed your plan limits for two consecutive months, we will contact you to discuss upgrading.
payment.planChangesBody: You can upgrade or downgrade your plan at any time. Upgrades take effect immediately. Downgrading may result in loss of features or capacity. We do not accept liability for any data loss resulting from plan downgrades.
payment.refundsBody: All fees are non-refundable. However, if you experience significant service issues within the first 30 days, please contact us and we'll work with you to find a fair solution.
payment.overdueBody: If payment is overdue, we may suspend access until you settle your balance.

cancellation.title: Cancellation and Termination
cancellation.li1: Subscription cancellation: Keeps your account but stops billing. Analytics data retained for 1 month.
cancellation.li2: Account deletion: Permanently deletes everything immediately, including all analytics data.
cancellation.howToBody: You can cancel your subscription or delete your account entirely through your account settings. An email request alone is not considered proper cancellation.
cancellation.whLi1: Subscription cancellation: Your cancellation takes effect at the end of your current billing period. You won't be charged again. Your analytics data becomes inaccessible but is retained for 1 month in case you return, then permanently deleted.
cancellation.whLi2: Account deletion: All data (personal and analytics) is permanently deleted immediately. This cannot be undone.
cancellation.residualCopies: Residual copies of deleted data may remain in encrypted backups for up to 30 days for disaster recovery purposes but will not be used or accessed.
cancellation.ourRightBody: We reserve the right to suspend or terminate your account for violation of these terms, illegal activity, or abuse of our service or team members. We will provide notice when possible, but immediate termination may be necessary in severe cases.

serviceMods.title: Service Modifications and Pricing
serviceMods.li1: Service changes: We reserve the right to modify or discontinue any part of the service with or without notice. We will communicate significant changes affecting your usage in advance when possible.
serviceMods.li2: Pricing changes: We may change our pricing structure. Existing customers are typically exempt from price increases, but we reserve the right to change prices for all customers with at least 30 days notice via email.
serviceMods.li3: Feature updates: We regularly improve our service with new features and enhancements. Some features may require plan upgrades.
serviceMods.li4: Beta features: Beta or experimental features may be offered for testing. These are provided without warranty and may be modified or discontinued at any time.

dataOwnership.title: Data Ownership and Privacy
dataOwnership.yourRightsBody: You own 100% of your analytics data. We claim no intellectual property rights over your website data and will never sell or share it with third parties.
dataOwnership.anonymousDataBody: By default, analytics data collected through Betterlytics is anonymized and designed to prevent the identification of individual visitors. Personally identifiable information is not collected or stored unless customers enable specific features (e.g., session replays, custom identifiers) that may involve pseudo-anonymous or personal data. We act as a data processor when handling personal or pseudo-anonymous data you provide (e.g., in features like session replays). You are the data controller and must ensure compliance with GDPR, CCPA, or other applicable data laws (e.g. obtaining consent, disclosing in your privacy policy).
dataOwnership.dpaBodyPrefix: For enterprise customers and GDPR compliance, our comprehensive Data Processing Agreement (DPA) is available at
dataOwnership.dpaBodySuffix: . The DPA forms part of these Terms of Service and governs how we process data on your behalf.
dataOwnership.yrLi1: Ensure your use of our service complies with all applicable privacy laws (GDPR, CCPA, etc.)
dataOwnership.yrLi2: Update your privacy policy to mention the use of Betterlytics for anonymous analytics (note: no cookie consent banner is typically required since our service is cookieless)
dataOwnership.yrLi3: Do not attempt to send sensitive information (credit cards, personal data, etc.) through our service, including in URL paths or query parameters.
dataOwnership.yrLi4: Maintain security of your account and immediately report any unauthorized access
dataOwnership.ocLi1: Process your data only as described in our Privacy Policy
dataOwnership.ocLi2: Implement appropriate security measures to protect your data
dataOwnership.ocLi3: Never sell, share, or monetize your analytics data
dataOwnership.ocLi4: Provide EU-based hosting and processing for GDPR compliance
dataOwnership.ocLi5: Delete your data immediately upon account deletion
dataOwnership.finalRemarks: Your use of Betterlytics is also governed by our Privacy Policy, which explains how we collect, process, and store data, including website visitor analytics and your account information. By using our service, you agree to the practices described in the Privacy Policy in addition to these Terms of Service.

sla.title: Service Level and Support
sla.availabilityBody: We strive for high availability but provide the service on an "as is" and "as available" basis. We do not guarantee uninterrupted operation or error-free performance.
sla.availabilityBodySuffix: We may schedule maintenance; we'll endeavor to give advance notice.
sla.supportBody: Technical support is provided via email on a reasonable effort basis. We aim to respond promptly but do not guarantee specific response times.
sla.bugsBody: We test our features extensively, but no software is perfect. We track reported bugs and prioritize fixes, especially for security or privacy issues. Not all reported bugs will be fixed immediately.

liability.title: Liability and Disclaimers
liability.p1: You expressly understand and agree that Betterlytics shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or exemplary damages, including but not limited to:
liability.li1: Loss of profits, goodwill, use, data, or other intangible losses
liability.li2: The use or inability to use our services
liability.li3: Unauthorized access to or alteration of your data
liability.li4: Statements or conduct of any third party
liability.li5: Any other matter relating to these Terms or our services
liability.note: What this means: While we work hard to provide reliable, privacy-focused analytics, technology isn't perfect and things can go wrong. By using Betterlytics, you understand that we can't be held responsible for any business losses or problems that might result from service issues. We're committed to earning your trust through transparency, strong security practices, and putting your privacy first.
liability.p2: No Warranty:  The Service is provided "as is" and "as available," without warranties of any kind, whether express, implied, or statutory, including but not limited to implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, title, and non-infringement.
liability.p3: Indemnification: You agree to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Betterlytics, its affiliates, employees, and contractors from and against any claims, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable legal fees) arising from your use of the Service, your violation of these Terms, or your violation of any law or third-party rights.
liability.p4: Force Majeure: Neither party shall be liable for any failure or delay in performance due to circumstances beyond reasonable control, including but not limited to acts of nature, power outages, internet failures, labor disputes, or government restrictions.
liability.p5: These Terms are governed by the laws of the Kingdom of Denmark and applicable laws of the European Union.
liability.p6: The courts of Copenhagen, Denmark have exclusive jurisdiction over disputes.
liability.p7: Parties will first attempt to resolve issues amicably. If unresolved, disputes may be submitted to arbitration in Denmark or another mutually agreed EU forum.
liability.p8: Our total liability shall not exceed the amount you paid in the past 12 months

ip.title: Intellectual Property
ip.li1: Your content: You retain all rights to any content you provide to our service. Your website data remains yours.
ip.li2: Our service: We hold all IP rights in the Service, user interface, infrastructure, trademarks, and proprietary software not covered by the AGPL.
ip.li3: Feedback: If you suggest features, improvements, or feedback, you grant us a perpetual, royalty-free license to use, modify, and incorporate that feedback without obligation to you.
ip.li4: Trademarks: "Betterlytics" and our logo are our trademarks. You may not use them without written permission, except to identify our service in connection with your legitimate use.
ip.li5: Open source components: Our open source parts are licensed under AGPL-3.0; this does not extend to our hosted backend, infrastructure, or service components not included in the public repositories.

updates.title: Updates and Communication
updates.p1: We may revise these Terms from time to time.
updates.li1: If we make material changes, we will notify you at least 30 days in advance via email.
updates.li2: Your continued use after changes take effect constitutes acceptance.
updates.li3: If you disagree, you may cancel your account before the changes take effect.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.lead: If you have any questions about these Terms of Service, please contact us:
contact.footer1: üá™üá∫ Made and hosted in the European Union

seo.title: Data Processing Agreement (DPA) | GDPR & Privacy Analytics
seo.description: Betterlytics Data Processing Agreement (DPA) ‚Äî built for full GDPR compliance, privacy-first analytics, and secure, anonymous data processing.

dpa.translationDisclaimer: This document is provided in multiple languages for convenience. In case of discrepancies, the English version shall prevail.
dpa.title: Data Processing Agreement (DPA)

scope.title: Scope of This DPA
scope.body: This Data Processing Agreement (‚ÄúDPA‚Äù) forms part of the Betterlytics Terms of Service and governs the processing of data when you use the Betterlytics hosted cloud service available at betterlytics.io and our official domains. This DPA does not apply to self-hosted installations of our open source software; if you self-host Betterlytics, you are responsible for your own data processing agreements and compliance with applicable laws.
scope.appliesTo: This DPA applies to the processing of website visitor data collected via Betterlytics analytics scripts, including both:
scope.li2: Personal or pseudo-anonymous data (optional features, or any accidental inclusion of personal or pseudo-anonymous data in URLs, query parameters, or event payloads), e.g., session replay, custom identifiers, or custom events.

definitions.title: Definitions
definitions.controller: "Data Controller": You (the customer) who determines the purposes and means of processing data from your website visitors.
definitions.processor: "Data Processor": Betterlytics, who processes data on your behalf according to your instructions and this DPA.
definitions.processing: "Processing": Collection, storage, analysis, and reporting of website visitor data.
definitions.personalData: "Personal Data": Any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person. In Betterlytics, this includes any data collected via optional features or accidentally included in default tracking (URLs, query parameters, or event payloads).
definitions.subprocessor: "Subprocessor": Any third-party service engaged by Betterlytics to assist with data processing.

processingDetails.title: Data Processing Details
processingDetails.npLi1: Providing analytics on website traffic and visitor behavior.
processingDetails.npLi2: Generating aggregated reports on website traffic and usage patterns
processingDetails.npLi3: Detecting and filtering bot traffic for accurate statistics
processingDetails.catLi1: Anonymized IP addresses (last octet removed immediately)
processingDetails.sLi1: Website visitors whose data is captured by the Betterlytics scripts.
processingDetails.sLi2: When only anonymous data is collected, data subjects cannot be identified.
processingDetails.sLi3: For optional features or accidental inclusion of personal/pseudo-anonymous data, data subjects may be identifiable. The Data Controller is responsible for lawful processing.
processingDetails.locationBody: All processing occurs on servers located within the European Union.
processingDetails.pdLi1: Session replay data containing user interaction details
processingDetails.pdLi2: Custom event data containing user identifiers or PII
processingDetails.pdLi4: Potential personal/pseudo-anonymous data (via optional features or accidental inclusion in default tracking)

dataController.title: Obligations of the Data Controller
dataController.li1: Ensure that its use of Betterlytics is lawful under GDPR, CCPA, and other applicable data protection laws.
dataController.li2: Determine the lawful basis for processing personal/pseudo-anonymous data collected via optional features or accidentally in default tracking.
dataController.li3: Update its website privacy policy to disclose the use of Betterlytics and any optional features that may collect personal or pseudo-anonymous data.
dataController.li4: Mask or remove personal data from URLs, query parameters, or custom events to prevent accidental collection.
dataController.li5: Ensure that end users are provided appropriate privacy notices and consent mechanisms where required.

dataProcessor.title: Obligations of the Data Processor (Betterlytics)
dataProcessor.li1: Process data only on documented instructions from the Data Controller.
dataProcessor.li2: Implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure data security, including:
dataProcessor.li21: TLS 1.2/1.3 encryption for data in transit
dataProcessor.li22: Industry-standard encryption for data at rest
dataProcessor.li23: Access controls limiting data access to authorized personnel only
dataProcessor.li25: EU-based servers in secure data centers
dataProcessor.li26: Immediate IP anonymization at data collection point
dataProcessor.li3: Assist the Data Controller in responding to requests from data subjects when personal/pseudo-anonymous data is processed.
dataProcessor.li4: Delete all analytics data immediately upon account deletion.

subprocessors.title: Subprocessors
subprocessors.intro: Betterlytics may engage subprocessors to perform parts of the processing, including:
subprocessors.li1: EU-based cloud hosting and infrastructure providers
subprocessors.notice: Betterlytics maintains a current list of subprocessors at betterlytics.io/subprocessors and will notify the Data Controller of any additions or changes.

rights.title: Data Subject Rights
rights.li1: For anonymous data: Data subject rights do not apply, as individuals cannot be identified.
rights.li2: When personal or pseudo-anonymous data is collected‚Äîwhether through optional features (e.g., session replay, custom identifiers, custom events) or accidentally included in default tracking (URLs, query parameters, or event payloads)‚ÄîBetterlytics will assist the Data Controller in fulfilling data subject rights under GDPR. This includes requests for access, correction, deletion, restriction of processing, or objection, as applicable.

breach.title: Data Breach Notification
breach.intro: In the unlikely event of a security incident affecting our service:
breach.li1: Betterlytics will notify the Data Controller within 72 hours of discovering any personal data breach affecting optional features that process personal/pseudo-anonymous data.
breach.li2: Notifications will include details of the breach, potential impact, and mitigation measures.

deletion.title: Data Deletion
deletion.accountBody: All data, including optional personal/pseudo-anonymous data, is permanently deleted immediately.
deletion.subscriptionBody: Data is retained for 1 month in case the account is reactivated, then permanently deleted.

liability.title: Liability and Indemnification
liability.li1: Betterlytics is liable only for processing performed outside the instructions of the Data Controller or in breach of this DPA.
liability.li2: The Data Controller is responsible for ensuring lawful use of optional features that may process personal or pseudo-anonymous data.
liability.li3: Data Controller agrees to indemnify Betterlytics for any claims arising from unlawful use of any feature provided by Betterlytics.

misc.title: Miscellaneous
misc.li1: This DPA forms part of the Terms of Service.
misc.li2: Any disputes regarding data processing will be governed by the laws of the European Union, with courts in Copenhagen, Denmark having exclusive jurisdiction.
misc.li3: This DPA is effective as of the last update date above and remains in effect while the customer uses Betterlytics services.

contact.title: Contact for DPA Matters
contact.lead: For questions about this DPA or data processing practices:
contact.footer: This DPA is automatically accepted when you use Betterlytics and forms part of our Terms of Service. üá™üá∫ Anonymous-by-design analytics - Made and hosted in the European Union

seo.title: Subprocessors | GDPR Compliance & Data Processing
seo.description: View the complete list of Betterlytics subprocessors. Understand how we ensure GDPR compliance through carefully selected EU-based service providers.

subprocessors.translationDisclaimer: This document is provided in multiple languages for convenience. In case of discrepancies, the English version shall prevail.
subprocessors.title: Subprocessors
subprocessors.intro: Betterlytics engages a limited number of carefully selected third-party service providers (subprocessors) to help deliver our analytics platform. This page lists all subprocessors that may process data on behalf of our customers.

commitment.title: Our Commitment
commitment.body: We only work with subprocessors that meet our strict privacy and security standards. All subprocessors operate under data processing agreements and implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your data.

list.title: Current Subprocessors
list.intro: The following third-party services are authorized to process data on behalf of Betterlytics:

changes.title: Changes to Subprocessors
changes.body: We will update this page when we add or remove subprocessors. If you have subscribed to Betterlytics services, we will notify you of any changes to this list in accordance with our Data Processing Agreement (DPA).

dataProtection.title: Data Protection Measures
dataProtection.li1: All subprocessors operate under data processing agreements in accordance with data protection standards
dataProtection.li2: We prioritize EU-based providers to minimize data transfers outside the EU
dataProtection.li3: Where data transfers to third countries occur, appropriate safeguards (such as SCCs) are in place

contact.title: Questions?
contact.lead: If you have questions about our subprocessors or data processing practices:

footer.p1: üá™üá∫ Made and hosted in the European Union

page.heading: Upgrade your plan

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about our pricing and plans

changePlan.q: Can I change my plan anytime?
changePlan.a: Yes! You can upgrade or downgrade your plan at any time. Changes take effect immediately, and we will prorate the billing accordingly.

exceedLimit.q: What happens if I exceed my event limit?
exceedLimit.a: We will continue tracking your events and you will receive an email notification when you exceed your limit. If you exceed your limits for more than 30 days, there is a chance that your excessive tracked data will be deleted.

annualBilling.a: Currently we offer monthly billing only. Annual billing with discounts is coming soon!

freeOption.a: Yes! Our Growth plan includes 10,000 free events per month forever. No credit card required to get started.

cancelAnytime.a: Absolutely. You can cancel your subscription at any time. Your plan will remain active until the end of your current billing period.

paymentMethods.q: What payment methods do you accept?
paymentMethods.a: We accept all major credit cards (Visa, MasterCard, American Express) and support secure payments through our payment processor.

table.title: Performance breakdown
table.performanceDescr: Performance score (0‚Äì100) based on the following metric weights: LCP 30%, CLS 15%, FCP 15%, TTFB 10%, INP 30%.
table.opportunityDescr: Traffic-weighted potential improvement: traffic share √ó (100 ‚àí Performance).

descriptions.CLS: Measures visual stability. CLS captures how much content unexpectedly shifts while the page loads.
descriptions.LCP: Measures loading performance. LCP is the moment the largest text or image becomes visible.
descriptions.INP: Measures responsiveness. INP is the time from a user action until the next visual update.
descriptions.FCP: Shows when the first piece of content appears on the screen during page load.
descriptions.TTFB: Measures server response speed ‚Äî the time from request until the first byte is received.

sessionList.durationFilterAria: Filter sessions by minimum duration in seconds

emptyReplay.noSessionSelected: Select a replay to view its timeline.

player.recordingDisabled: Recording is disabled on this page

integration.title: Website Integration
integration.description: Select your framework and follow the setup steps to start collecting analytics
integration.npmPackageNote: Or install our <npm>npm</npm> package <package>@betterlytics/tracker</package> for easy setup for Node projects.

requiredModal.title: Email Verification Required
requiredModal.subtitle: Please verify your email to upgrade your plan
requiredModal.verifyLine: Hi {name}, we need to verify your email address {email} before you can upgrade to a paid plan.
requiredModal.sentInfo: Please check your inbox and spam folder. The verification link will expire in 24 hours.
requiredModal.toastSuccess: Verification email sent! Please check your inbox.

dialog.title: User Settings
dialog.description: Manage your account settings and preferences.

toast.error: Failed to save settings. Please try again.
Failed to update profile. Please try again.

appearance.title: Appearance
appearance.description: Customize the visual appearance of your dashboard

avatar.label: Avatar
avatar.noteIntro: Note: Gravatar is a third-party service - enabling it may share your email hash with their servers.

cta.upgradeHint: Upgrade your plan to get more events and unlock additional features.

billingPortal.title: Billing Portal
billingPortal.description: Manage your billing details and access your full billing history
billingPortal.explainer: View all past invoices, update payment methods, and manage your billing through Stripe's secure customer portal.
billingPortal.notAvailable: Billing portal will be available once you upgrade to a paid plan.
billingPortal.toastError: Failed to open billing portal, please try again.

security.title: Password & Authentication
security.passwordHelp: Password must be at least 8 characters long

totp.title: Two-Factor Authentication
totp.description: Add an extra layer of security to your account by requiring a second form of verification in addition to your password
totp.instructions: To enable 2FA, scan the QR code with your authenticator app or use the <setup>setup key</setup> to manually configure it, then enter the verification code below.
totp.disableDescription: Are you sure you want to disable two-factor authentication for your account?
totp.disableFailed: Failed to disable two-factor authentication. Please try again.

danger.title: Delete Account
danger.description: Permanently delete your account and all associated data
danger.warning: Warning: This action cannot be undone
danger.details: This will permanently delete your account, remove access to all dashboards, and delete all your personal settings.

dialog.title: Delete Account Permanently
dialog.description: Are you absolutely sure you want to delete your account? This action cannot be undone and will permanently:
dialog.li2: Remove access to all your dashboards
dialog.li4: Sign you out of all devices

toast.error: Failed to delete account. Please try again.
toast.unable: Unable to delete account. Please try signing in again.

dashboardSettingsDialog.title: Dashboard Settings
dashboardSettingsDialog.description: Configure your dashboard preferences and data collection settings.

data.title: Data Management
data.description: Configure data retention and collection preferences
data.retentionHelp: How long to keep analytics data before automatic deletion

retentionConfirm.title: Change retention period?
retentionConfirm.description: Are you sure you want to change the data retention period to {period}?

siteRules.title: Site Rules
siteRules.description: Control which incoming events are accepted.
siteRules.enforceDomainDescription: Reject events whose domain does not match the dashboard domain.
siteRules.enableValidationDescription: Only accept events from your configured domain

rename.title: Change Domain
rename.description: Change the domain associated with this dashboard. Your analytics data will be preserved.
rename.info: Your Site ID and tracking script remain unchanged.

blacklistedIps.title: Blacklisted IPs
blacklistedIps.description: Manage IP addresses for which incoming events are blocked.
blacklistedIps.addIpError: Enter a valid IPv4/IPv6 or CIDR range
blacklistedIps.noIps: No IP addresses are currently blacklisted

danger.title: Dashboard
danger.sectionDescription: Permanently remove this dashboard and all its data.

dialog.title: Delete Dashboard
dialog.description: Are you sure you want to delete this dashboard? This action cannot be undone.

leaveDashboard.title: Leave Dashboard
leaveDashboard.description: Are you sure you want to leave this dashboard?

dialog.title: Leave Dashboard
dialog.description: Are you sure you want to leave this dashboard? You will no longer be able to access it, and will need to be reinvited to join it again.

termsRequiredDialog.title: Accept Updated Terms of Service
termsRequiredDialog.body: To continue using your account, please review and accept our <termsLink>Terms of Service</termsLink>.

demoMode.interactionDisabled: Filtering from this interaction is disabled in the demo.

permissions.insufficientPermissions: You don't have permission to perform this action

bugReport.title: Report a bug
bugReport.description: Tell us what went wrong or what feels off. The more detail, the better!
bugReport.placeholder: Describe what happened, what you expected, and anything else that might help us reproduce the issue.

toast.error: Couldn't send the report. Please try again.
toast.empty: Please add a short description before sending.

changelog.title: What's New
changelog.haveFeedback: Have feedback? Tell us so the next release is even better.

onboarding.registrationDisabled: Registration is currently disabled on this instance.

feature1.title: Get started in under 2 minutes
feature1.description: Just add one line of code or install our npm package. No cookies, no pop-ups.

feature2.title: Free to get started
feature2.description: 10,000 events per month. No credit card. No commitment.

feature3.title: Privacy-first & open source
feature3.description: Cookieless, GDPR-compliant, and EU-hosted. Transparent and secure.

form.title: Create your account
form.termsAgreeLabel: I have read and agree to the <termsLink>Terms of Service</termsLink> and <privacyLink>Privacy Policy</privacyLink>.
form.registrationSuccessfulButSignInFailed: Registration successful, but sign in failed. Please try signing in manually.
form.signUpError: An error occurred during sign up. Please try again.

website.title: Set up your dashboard

website.termsAgreeLabel: I have read and agree to the <termsLink>Terms of Service</termsLink> and <privacyLink>Privacy Policy</privacyLink>.

siteId.description: This unique identifier connects your website to your dashboard

capabilities.dashboardLimit: You have reached your dashboard limit. Upgrade to Pro to create more dashboards.
capabilities.monitorLimit: You have reached your monitor limit. Upgrade to Pro to create more monitors.

usageAlert.title: Approaching event limit
usageAlert.description: You've used {percentage} of your monthly quota ({current} / {limit} events). Consider upgrading to avoid interruptions.

usageLimitExceeded.title: Event limit reached
usageLimitExceeded.description: You've used {percentage} of your monthly quota ({current} / {limit} events). Upgrade your plan to avoid data loss.

acceptPage.expiredHint: Please ask the dashboard owner to send you a new invitation.

acceptPage.emailMismatchHint: Sign out and sign in with the correct account to accept this invitation.
acceptPage.errorDescription: Something went wrong while accepting the invitation. It may have already been accepted or cancelled.

section.description: Connect third-party services to receive uptime monitoring notifications when your website goes down or recovers.

webhook.name: Webhook
webhook.description: Send notifications to any URL via HTTP POST.
